user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash_hex:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash_hex (enum MHD_DigestAuthAlgo3 algo3,
                                   const char *username,
                                   const char *realm,
                                   char *userhash_hex,
                                   size_t hex_buf_size)
{
  uint8_t userhash_bin[MAX_DIGEST];
  size_t digest_size;

  digest_size = digest_get_hash_size (algo3);
  if (digest_size * 2 + 1 > hex_buf_size)
    return MHD_NO;
  if (MHD_NO == MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (algo3, username, realm,
                                               userhash_bin, MAX_DIGEST))
    return MHD_NO;

  MHD_bin_to_hex_z (userhash_bin, digest_size, userhash_hex);
  return MHD_YES;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I examined the provided function body and found no use of the Standard Library function memcmp (or any apparent direct comparison of null-terminated strings using memcmp). All operations are: calling digest_get_hash_size, a buffer-size check, calling MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash, and converting binary to hex via MHD_bin_to_hex_z. None of these lines invoke memcmp in this fragment, so there are no code fragments here that violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14.

Note: The only external calls in this fragment are to MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash and MHD_bin_to_hex_z; those functions are not shown. If you want a full compliance judgment for the whole module, their implementations should be reviewed to ensure they do not use memcmp to compare null-terminated strings. However, within the supplied code fragment itself there are no memcmp usages to investigate.
